discussion.content: The answer is A. This is because ip address 192.168.10.45 is covered in the 192.168.10.32/27. So traffic is forwarded using that route because it has the highest prefix.

why have you choosen D ,
but me i would choose B Because it has known by the Int Fa0/0 directly connected

questions.question_text: Which technology supports the stateless assignment of IPv6 addresses?
questions.answer_description:
Stateless Auto Configuration is an important feature offered by the IPv6 protocol. It allows the various devices attached to an IPv6 network to connect to the
Internet using the Stateless Auto Configuration without requiring any intermediate IP support in the form of a Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) server. http://ipv6.com/articles/general/Stateless-Auto-Configuration.htm

discussion.content: The answer should be SLAAC. Based on the question, this is probably what D is supposed to be. DHCPv6 can be configured with SLAAC to assign DNS servers, for example, but if you use DHCPv6 to configure the IPv6 addresses then that is stateful assignment.

comments.content: DHCPv6 is statefull assignment. It is combination of mac addresse of dhcp Server and ipv4 addresse. So it is statefull assignment.

discussion.content: Technology supports the stateless assignment of IPv6 addresses is DHCPv6

questions.question_text: Which forwarding technology stores destination addresses in the cache?

discussion.content:
(continued)

In short:

 

Process switching is like doing math, long hand. 

 

Fast switching, using the cache, is like doing a problem once long hand, and subsequent problems you remember the answer for, (from memory, or the cache).

 

CEF is like having programmed an excel spreadsheet, and when the numbers hit the cells, the answer is already calculated.

(continued)

Cisco Express Forwarding (CEF), is the evolution of optimizing the router to make it be able to forward more packets faster. CEF cheats a little, by building a Forwarding Information Base (FIB), and an adjacency table. The FIB is accessed very quickly based on how they built it (it is Cisco proprietary), and contains pre-computed reverse lookups, next hop information for routes including the interface and L2 information to use. (All the stuff a router would have to consider when forwarding a packet).
The answer should be D (Fast Switching).

choices.A: R1, S1, S2, R3 and S3

questions.answer_description: A Cisco device enabled with CDP sends out periodic interface updates to a multicast address in order to make itself known to neighbors. Since it is a layer two protocol, these packets are not routed. So the devices detected would be immediate connected neighbors.

questions.question_text: Configuration of which option is required on a Cisco switch for the Cisco IP phone to work?

discussion.content: C is correct. Question didn't ask for configuration, it rather ask configuration option(s).

the correct answer is B 
to allow voice vlan the command is 
switchport access voice vlan ID

questions.answer_description: The switch has two VLANs: one carries data traffic and one carries voice traffic. The switch port can be either access VLAN or trunk VLAN, but you need to configure a voice VLAN to carry the voice traffic.

choices.D: Cisco Discovery Protocol in global configuration mode
choices.C: a voice VLAN ID in interface and global configuration mode
choices.B: the interface as an access port to allow the voice VLAN ID
